questions.question: All positive displacement pumps have pumping chambers.
questions.explanation: True; The volume of the pump body itself fixes the smount of fluid displayced

questions.question: Positive displacement pumps cannot handle entrained air.
questions.explanation: False; some positive displaycement pumps can handle air as well as liquid and can run dry

questions.question: Double-acting piston pumps discharge an equal amount of liquid on all strokes.
questions.explanation: False; because of the space that the piston rod occupies, the volume discharged on the return stroke is less

questions.question: Which one of the following reciprocating pumps can be allowed to run dry?
Rotary pumps produce a smoother flow than reciprocating pumps.
questions.explanation: True; all rotary pumps deliver a much smoother flow than reciprocating pumps

questions.question: Which of the following pumps is not dynamic?
What is the definition of absolute pressure?
What is the equivalent head of oil when a pressure gauge reads 100 psi (the oil density is 56 lb/ftÂ³)?
As pressure is reduced, the boiling point of a liquid decreases.
questions.explanation: True; a temperature increase in the liquid or too pressure at the pump suction can cause the liquid to begin to vaporize

questions.question: What occurs in a pump when a liquid vaporizes in a closed system?
A tank 20 feet high is full of brine. The RD of brine is 1.03. What would the reading be on a pressure gauge connected to a pipe leading from the bottom of the tank?
What could cause cavitation to occur?
options: A blockage in the discharge line.

questions.question: When the pump inlet is above the level of liquid in the supply reservoir, the pump has a suction head.
questions.explanation: False; suction head describes the condition where the level of the supply liquid is above the centreline of the pump

questions.question: What source of energy is available to allow liquid to enter a pump with suction lift?
Which pump component converts mechanical energy into kinetic energy?
What value must the NPSH_R be for proper pump operation?
Diffusers
options: Reduce in cross-section as the liquid passes through.
Rotate in the opposite direction to the impeller.
Rotate in the same direction as the impeller.

questions.question: Unless otherwise stated, pump performance curves are based on handling of what type of fluid?
Pump curves are provided by the pump manufacturer.
questions.explanation: True; there are many pump manufacturers in hte industry and they all have pump curves

questions.question: Referring to Figure 22, what value does the pump curve represent?
options: The head required by the pump.
The head required by the system.
The head available in the system.
The head available from the pump.
correctAnswer: The head available from the pump.

questions.question: What does not contribute to friction loss through pipes?
options: Velocity of the fluid in the pipe

questions.question: What could be a possible cause for an increase in differential pressure across a strainer?
options: The screen in the strainer has been removed.
The strainer needs to be cleaned.
The operating temperature of the system has increased.
correctAnswer: The strainer needs to be cleaned.

questions.question: When you have a safe work permit to service a pump, what is the first thing you must do before commencing work?
options: Drain and vent the piping system.
Isolate the pump's prime mover (tagged and locked out).
correctAnswer: Isolate the pump's prime mover (tagged and locked out).
